thread.title: Attorney General says trooper shooting was justified
thread.title_full: Attorney General says trooper shooting was justified - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: WCAX News
title: Attorney General says trooper shooting was justified
text:
FAYSTON, Vt. - The shooting of a suspect in Fayston by a Vermont State Trooper was justified. That's the conclusion of an investigation by the Attorney General's office.
Forty-eight year-old Robert Smallidge was wounded in the leg during a confrontation with a trooper at the home of Smallidge's ex-wife in Fayston. Trooper Christopher Brown fired after Smallidge refused repeated verbal commands and then reached for a rifle. Smalllidge was not seriously hurt. Smallidge is facing charges of unlawful trespass and simple assault.
Washington County District Attorney Scott Williams says audio from the dash-cam recording demonstrates the trooper's fear.
"It's clear, absolutely clear from his physical reaction reaction and voice, he saw something he legitimately believes is a threat to his life," said Williams.
Trooper Brown is back on duty for the Vermont State Police working out of the Middlesex barracks.

Was Vt. trooper justified in shooting Brattleboro man?
Trooper-involved shooting in Fayston
